details.title: Phase 5: Big seats, important faces
details.content: The fifth phase of polling in 14 Lok Sabha seats in Uttar Pradesh will see a clash of titans, including Union ministers Rajnath Singh and Smriti Irani, UPA chairperson Sonia Gandhi and Congress president Rahul Gandhi. The stakes are high for the ruling BJP and its allies as it had swept 40 of these seats in 2014, leaving just two for the Congress (Sonia Gandhi's Rae Bareli and Rahul Gandhi's Amethi) and the rest for other opposition parties such as the Trinamool Congress (seven).
Voting begins in the fifth phase of Lok Sabha Elections 2019

Rajasthan: #Visuals from a polling booth in Jaipur. #LokSabhaElections2019 pic.twitter.com/zMs39NG9QA

— ANI (@ANI) May 6, 2019

details.title: EC rejects demand for early polling on account of Ramzan
details.content: The Election Commission on Sundayrejected a pleato reschedule the commencement of polls during the last three phases of the Lok Sabha elections to 5 am instead of 7 am due to Ramzan.

details.title: Former Olympian Rajyavardhan Singh Rathore (BJP) is pitted against another Olympian Krishna Poonia (Congress) in the Jaipur Rural seat.
details.content:
इस नीली स्याही में देश का भविष्य गढ़ने की ताकत है। हमने तो राष्ट्रनिर्माण में अपना योगदान कर दिया, अब आपकी बारी है। एक मजबूत भारत बनाने के लिए अपने वोट का इस्तेमाल ज़रूर करें। pic.twitter.com/oF1vrkgQQS

— Chowkidar Rajyavardhan Rathore (@Ra_THORe) May 6, 2019

details.title: BJP MLA in Madhya Pradesh booked
details.content: BJP MLA Sharad Lal from Madhya Pradesh's Beohari seat of adjoining Shahdol district, was booked by police for model code of conduct violation for allegedly campaigning among voters in Satna 's Ramnagar area just a few hours before polling.

details.title: Rajnath Singh is seeking to retain BJP stronghold Lucknow. His opponents are Samajwadi Party’s Poonam Sinha and Congress’s Pramod Krishnam.
details.content:
Home Minister and Lucknow BJP Candidate Rajnath Singh casts his vote at polling booth 333 in Scholars' Home School pic.twitter.com/BXSZTvFeGS

— ANI UP (@ANINewsUP) May 6, 2019

details.title: Voting yet to begin in few booths in Howrah
details.content: Voting yet to begin in booth numbers 289/ 291/292 in West Bengal's Howrah, reportedly after glitches in EVMs and VVPATs. (ANI)

details.title: Former minister Yashwant Sinha arrives to vote in Jharkhand's Hazaribagh
details.content:
Hazaribagh: Former Union Min Yashwant Sinha & wife Nilima Sinha arrive at a polling booth to cast vote for #LokSabhaElections2019 . His son & Union Minister Jayant Sinha is contesting against Congress' Gopal Sahu & CPI's Bhubneshwar Prasad Mehta from the constituency. #Jharkhand pic.twitter.com/r0F9V9Fffr

— ANI (@ANI) May 6, 2019

As polling for #Phase5 of #GeneralElections2019 begins, here's what is at stake today

Graphics courtesy : KBK#LokSabhaElections2019 pic.twitter.com/x2GO3FU4En

— PIB India (@PIB_India) May 6, 2019

details.title: Prime Minister Modi urges citizens to vote
details.content:
Requesting all those voting in today’s fifth phase of the 2019 Lok Sabha elections to do so in large numbers.

A vote is the most effective way to enrich our democracy and contribute to India’s better future.

I hope my young friends turnout in record numbers.

— Chowkidar Narendra Modi (@narendramodi) May 6, 2019

details.title: In Jammu and Kashmir, polling is taking place in Ladakh constituency and Pulwama and Shopian districts of Anantnag seat.
details.content:
Jammu and Kashmir: Visuals from polling booth 66 in Govt High School in Pulwama( Anantnag Lok Sabha seat) #LokSabhaElections2019 pic.twitter.com/EKLbGTmkX3

— ANI (@ANI) May 6, 2019

details.title: EVM, VVPAT glitches in booths in Rae Bareli and Amethi
details.content: 5 booths in Amethi have reported glitches in the EM-VVPAT machines. TV reports say that booths in Rae Bareli too are facing a similar issue.

details.title: Mayawati, who had earlier announced that she would not be contesting polls this time, had also said that she could contest later, if required, from any seat held by her party.
details.content:
BSP Chief Mayawati casts her vote at a polling booth in City Montessori Inter College in Lucknow. #LokSabhaElections2019 pic.twitter.com/h28DExxZ8E

— ANI UP (@ANINewsUP) May 6, 2019

details.title: TMC workers allegedly heckle BJP Barrackpore candidate
details.content:
Arjun Singh, who recently joined the BJP after leaving TMC, alleged that the attack took place in the presence of Inspector-in-charge, Barrackpore.

West Bengal: Arjun Singh, BJP candidate from Barrackpore alleges that he was attacked by TMC workers, says,"I was attacked by TMC goons who have been brought from outside. Those people were scaring away our voters. I am injured." pic.twitter.com/lWXY3mbbZZ

— ANI (@ANI) May 6, 2019

details.title: Rajnath Singh says he can't predict anything
details.content:
"I leave the decision to the voters in Lucknow. The people have the full right to choose who they want... In any case, Prime Minister Modi will become PM again," said the Home Minister. (NDTV)

Rajnath Singh,Lucknow BJP candidate: The Mahagatbandhan is no challenge for BJP here. I don't want to comment on her(SP-BSP-RLD candidate Poonam Sinha), as I believe elections are not about individuals but about issues. pic.twitter.com/FdwsHdj7nd

— ANI UP (@ANINewsUP) May 6, 2019

details.title: Grenade attack in polling booth at Pulwama
details.content: A grenade was lobbed towards Rohmoo polling station in Pulwama but there were no reports of any casualties in the blast.

details.title: BJP's Amethi candidate and Union Minister Smriti Irani attacks Rahul Gandhi
details.content: "This battle is between the poor people of Amethi versus Rahul Gandhi. He can choose to not answer people but he will have to answer God": Smriti Irani to reporters

Smriti Irani also reiterated that a man died in Amethi after being rejected treatment by a hospital associated with the Gandhi family for having an Ayushman Bharat card, even as the hospital denied the allegations as "baseless".

Smriti Irani: A person died as he was denied treatment at hospital where Rahul Gandhi is trustee,in Amethi just because he had Ayushman Bharat card. Ye parivaar itna ghinona hai ki ek nirdosh ko maut ke ghat utarne ko taiyar hai sirf isliye kyunki unhe apni rajneeti pyari hai pic.twitter.com/DersIyWwxs

— ANI UP (@ANINewsUP) May 6, 2019
Union Minister and BJP's Lucknow candidate Rajnath Singh poses with his family after casting their votes. (Photo | By Special Arrangement)
Jammu and Kashmir: Most of the polling booths in main Pulwama town and Shopian look deserted as voters stay away from booths.
Jammu and Kashmir: Brisk polling taking place in Pulwama's Khrew area. It is the hometown of NC candidate for Anantnag seat Hasnain Masoodi.

Jharkhand: A man arrived with his 105-year-old mother to cast votes at polling booth number 450 in Hazaribagh. #LokSabhaElections2019 pic.twitter.com/PGTF49ztlw

— ANI (@ANI) May 6, 2019
A senior citizen in Bihar's Hajipur is welcomed with a crown at a polling booth. (Photo | EPS)

details.title: Voter turnout as of 10 am
details.content: At 10 am, the overall voter turnout is 12.65%. Bihar: 11.51% Jammu and Kashmir: 1.36% Madhya Pradesh: 13.08% Rajasthan: 14.00% Uttar Pradesh: 9.86% West Bengal: 16.56% Jharkhand: 13.46%
A man named Ranjit Paswan has been arrested on charges of vandalizing an EVM machine at polling booth number 131 in Chhapra, Bihar. (ANI)

details.title: Smriti Irani alleges booth capturing in Amethi
details.content:
Alert @ECISVEEP Congress President @RahulGandhi ensuring booth capturing. https://t.co/KbAgGOrRhI

— Chowkidar Smriti Z Irani (@smritiirani) May 6, 2019

details.title: Re-polling underway in five Andhra Pradesh booths
details.content: Polling is going on in the five booths in Guntur, Prakasam and Nellore districts and it will continue till 6 p.m.

Madhya Pradesh: A man in Chhatarpur arrives to vote, after his father's last rites earlier today. #LokSabhaElections2019 #Phase5 pic.twitter.com/99YoCEJ7Ch

— ANI (@ANI) May 6, 2019

details.title: Locket Chatterjee alleges false voting
details.content: BJP's Hooghly candidate Locket Chatterjee gets into in an argument with alleged TMC supporters in Dhonekhali area of Hooghly constituency. She alleges TMC isn't allowing BJP polling agents to enter the booth.
Saints and seers cast their votes in Ayodhya, Uttar Pradesh. (Photo | EPS)

details.title: Home guard dies of suspected heart attack
details.content: A home guard named Mahesh Dubey died while on duty in Betul Lok Sabha seat early today. He was found unconscious in the bathroom of the polling booth and was rushed to a hospital, where doctors declared him dead on arrival. He is suspected to have had a heart attack.
In Satna LS seat's Tikuria Tola booth, the Gupta family pose for a photo before going to attend the last rites of their mother Savitri Gupta who passed away on Sunday. (Photo | EPS)

Congress spokesperson Zeeshan Haider responds to Smriti Irani's allegations of booth capture: "Now, she is looking for excuses. If Rahul Gandhi is capturing booths, and capturing votes, then what is the election commission doing? They are biased towards Modi and Amit Shah."

details.title: Voter turnout as of 1 pm
details.content:
#Phase5 of #LokSabhaElections2019 records a voter turnout of 38.55% at 1 pm. West Bengal leads with over 48% turnout.

— The New Indian Express (@NewIndianXpress) May 6, 2019
Satna District collector Satyendra Singh helps a differently-abled voter. (Photo | EPS)

A Kashmiri Pandit migrant woman shows her finger marked with indelible ink after casting vote at a polling station during the fifth phase of the 2019 Lok Sabha elections in Jammu on 6 May 2019. (Photo | PTI)
A TMC leader allegedly beat up a BJP worker outside a booth in Shibpur in West Bengal’s Howrah district. (TV reports)

details.title: PM Modi addresses rally in Tamluk in West Bengal’s East Medinipur district
details.content:
PM Modi slams Mamata Banerjee over the viral video of her shouting at people chanting 'Jai Shri Ram'.

#WATCH: PM Modi in Tamluk,West Bengal,says,"Didi is so frustrated these days that she doesn't even want to talk or hear about god. Situation is such that Didi is arresting and jailing those who are chanting 'Jai Sri Ram'." pic.twitter.com/xzzszenmiO

— ANI (@ANI) May 6, 2019

details.title: Second grenade attack in Pulwama polling booth today
details.content: Grenade attack at a polling booth reported from Cahapora in Jammu and Kashmir's Pulwama, outside the wall of Government Higher Secondary School.

details.title: Congress President Rahul Gandhi is addressing a rally in Bhiwani, Haryana
details.content:
#WATCH Rahul Gandhi in Bhiwani,Haryana: Narendra Modi the boxer was supposed to fight unemployment,farmer problems,corruption etc but he instead turned around & punched his coach Advani ji,his team Gadkari ji Jaitley ji, then went into crowd and punched small traders and farmers pic.twitter.com/jiJAmVxqzO

— ANI (@ANI) May 6, 2019

details.title: Madhya Pradesh's Pavai CEO scolds women voters for boycotting elections
details.content: Satish Nagwanshi got into an argument with women voters who are boycotting voting over drinking water woes in Panna district of MP's Bundelkhand region.

details.title: Man casts vote moments after father's last rites
details.content: Madhya Pradesh's Bundelkhand region went for voting on May 6. One of the voters had come directly after his father's funeral to cast his vote.

details.content:

details.title: Voter turnout as of 3 pm
details.content: Till 3 pm, the overall voter turnout is 50.70%. Bihar: 44.08% Jammu and Kashmir: 15.34% Madhya Pradesh: 53.18% Rajasthan: 50.39% Uttar Pradesh: 44.10% West Bengal: 62.69% Jharkhand: 58.63%

Interim turnout data from the States in which polling is being held today in #Phase5 of #LokSabhaElections2019. #GotInked (Updated till 3pm) pic.twitter.com/mF4jjjO3iF

details.title: Congress candidate Nirmal Khatri talks about politics, Modi and much more
details.content:
Uttar Pradesh's Faizabad constituency went for polls in the fifth phase of Lok Sabha elections on May 6. Faizabad's Congress candidate, Nirmal Khatri shared his views on Elections 2019.

details.title: Jammu & Kashmir: Petrol bomb hurled at polling booth in Shopian school
details.content: Petrol bomb was hurled at a polling station in south Kashmir’s Shopian, today, no loss of life or injuries reported. (ANI)

details.title: BJP leader Locket Chatterjee stages sit-in at DM's office in Hooghly
details.content: BJP candidate from Hooghly Lok Sabha constituency Locket Chatterjee stages a sit-in protest at District Magistrate's office after her car was allegedly vandalised. Chatterjee had earlier alleged fake voting in her constituency. (ANI)

details.content:
